message.content:
cs.CV, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.HC. 

The paper focuses on visual recommendation, which involves the use of visual information to make recommendations. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a DeepStyle method for learning style features of items, which involves the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs), a common technique in computer vision. This further supports the likelihood of the paper belonging to the cs.CV sub-category. 

However, the paper also involves the modeling of users' preferences and demands, which suggests that it may also belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The paper proposes a Context-Aware Gated Recurrent Unit (CA-GRU) method for capturing sequential and contextual information, which is a common technique in natural language processing and time-series analysis, suggesting that the paper may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the study of users' selection behaviors, which suggests that it may also belong to the human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-category.
